abstract: Students of The Freedom Theater, Arab-language troupe in West Bank refugee camp, will perform Samuel Beckett's Waiting for Godot to celebrate legacy of founder Juliano Mer Khamis, who was assassinated earlier this year.
snippet: The Freedom Theater students of Juliano Mer Khamis, who was assassinated this year on the West Bank, are bringing an adaptation in Arabic of Samuel Beckett’s “Waiting for Godot” to the Miller Theater.
lead_paragraph: The Freedom Theater students of Juliano Mer Khamis, who was assassinated this year on the West Bank, are bringing an adaptation in Arabic of Samuel Beckett’s “Waiting for Godot” to the Miller Theater.

headline.main: After a Killing, Trying to Heal Through Theater
headline.print_headline: After a Killing, Trying to Heal Through Theater
headline.seo: Freedom Theater Students Perform at Columbia University
